heart I have written my law. We are truly of God, not only when our acts reflect obedience to God's law but when our hearts—meaning our feelings, desires, attitudes, and intentions—are all turned to do his will. When we submit ourselves to God, he writes his law in our hearts even as he wrote the law on tablets of stone in Moses' day (Ps. 37:31; 40:8; 119:34).

fear ye not the reproach of men. Joseph Smith taught that persecution should not cause the Saints to falter: "I have reason to think that the Church is being purged…. So long as men are under the law of God, they have no fears."
